main event: Civilians observed six objects in formation around a cosmic research balloon in Tuscaloosa, Alabama, on February 1, 1954.
interesting points: The objects quickly joined in formation behind a leader, appearing to move slowly under the balloon before accelerating straight up at right angles., Observers were tracking cosmic research balloons when they noticed the objects., The sighting lasted around 15 minutes., The objects emitted no sound and were described as bright white., Multiple photos were taken during the observation, pending analysis by the Navy.
sighted object: six bright white objects in the sky
witness description: Civilian observers tracking cosmic research balloons.
